text: hi everyone anthony fantano here
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of this new panda bear
and sonic boom record reset this is a
brand new lp from neo psych wizard
animal collective's own panda bear
continuing to build out his discography
here with a fresh collaboration with the
one and only sonic boom of spacemen
three fame when it comes to modern
psychedelic street cred uh it really
doesn't get much better or more closely
connected to the artistic lineage of
bands like animal collective well maybe
there's one more thing that inspires the
music of panda bear even more and that
is a love of vintage psychedelic rock
and pop which also goes for sonic boom
and that's pretty much what these two
bond over here devising their own little
trippy quirked up interpretations of the
sonics of the 60s for nine tracks and 38
minutes and in one breath it is
interesting to hear panda bear embracing
his love of guys like brian wilson so
boldly that some tracks on this thing
feel like futuristic leftovers from the
smile sessions but with that being said
this lp is also plagued by many of the
same song writing and structuring issues
that i typically have with panda bears
records with an overall lack of
development and dynamics repeating
certain ideas until they've lost their
flavor which i get the psychedelic
sensations that repeating certain
phrases over and over can conjure it's
just that sometimes i find panda bears
instrumental palettes to be maybe a
little thin and not all that enveloping
the idea of getting lost in them doesn't
even cross my mind which is pretty much
the case for the song go on with what
sounds like some plotting bass as well
as these repeating springy surf rock
guitar chords and granted panda bear and
sonic boom do add tiny subtle touches of
color as the song progresses claps and
morsels of percussion as well as some
kind of bold vocal harmonies and phaser
effects i can't argue that there isn't
some semblance of progression here but
it just doesn't go far enough for me
the same goes for the track in my body
which has one of the more open spacious
and surreal instrumental palettes of the
entire lp and that does make it stand
out but by that same token it's just a
little too thin to be all that
gratifying it's like just slurping on um
broth whirlpool is easily my least
favorite here not just because of its
mind numbing repetitions but the buzzing
sound effects that are placed on the
vocals make it a tad bit grating then
there's danger which is based on a lot
of very quaint acoustic loops those are
topped with beautiful poetry about
metaphorically twisting in the wind
versus being held down and safe in a
consistent relationship or partnership
but also that dependency in a way
creates a sense of danger for panda bear
narratively there are some interesting
dynamics going on here i just wish the
track had more to offer instrumentally
because i feel like by the time we've
hit around the halfway point we've
pretty much heard everything the song
has to offer now there are some tracks
on here that transcend the limitations
of their repetitious instrumentals as
well as minuscule touches the track
every day for example i just think the
song at the core of this one is really
cute doesn't so much feel like a
long-winded motif more like a velvet
underground inspired jam there's
actually a droning quality to a lot of
the vocals and backing instrumentation
too that just makes it easy to give into
this one there's also edge of the edge
which i think has a strong tune at the
core of it too which doesn't offer a big
grand finish or ending or anything but
the pleasant contrast between the
heavenly song verses and sparkling
synthesizers is just enough to keep me
locked in for the five minutes it lasts
there are a few tracks on here that hit
harder than others as far as maybe
having more of a groove more of a pop
appeal more volume but it's
kind of ironic that these cuts end up
being the shortest on the lp and i end
up just wanting more from them by the
time they end like the opener getting to
the point there's a lot of fun vivacious
acoustic guitar loops on this one little
effects and noises circling around the
instrumental that actually feel
kind of chaotic and adding to this kind
of endearing cacophony it's heartwarming
it's sweet the lyrics on the track two
are very much about getting back to
basics which i think is
kind of the modus operandi of this
record there's also living in the after
who's instrumental i am absolutely in
love with but uh most of it is pretty
much based on some hefty sampling from
the drifter save the last dance for me
and this sample does a lot of the leg
work on this track in fact panda bear's
vocal melodies
are very akin to the original song as
well it kind of feels like he's just
reworking it in a way lightly we do get
a strong closer on this lp though with
some speedily throbbing electronics and
completely angelic vocal harmonies
calling out about something coming this
way there's just an intensely warm
sensation coming off this track that i
want to bask in like the rays of the
summer sun and yeah that's this records
tracklist in a nutshell just a lot of
throwback 60s pop and rock vibes some
psychedelic and experimental touches of
sound here and there pretty decent vocal
lines and harmonies to be had too
stylistically i would say nothing
revolutionary for panda bear though and
of course again you do have that very
one-dimensional repetitive linear
songwriting approach that i think he
just doesn't push far enough much of the
time in terms of building and developing
and releasing the tension that is being
compounded over the course of some of
these tracks overall feeling a light too
decent six on this one tran position
have you given this record a listen did
you love it did you hate it what would
you rate it you're the best you're the
best what should i review next hit the
like if you like please subscribe and
please don't cry hit the bell as well
over here next to my head it's another
video you can check out hit that up or
the link to subscribe to the channel
anthony fantano panda bear sonic boom
forever
